speaker: Clinician
text: Okay, quick check—I’m flipping through notes. New budesonide-formoterol canister arrived? Two puffs morning, two night.

speaker: Clinician
text: Formulary swap means the tube, uh, looks blue-white now; same drug inside. Any throat scratch or shakes lately?

speaker: Clinician
text: Nurse will log each hit, but if planes stay grounded, say, five weeks and supplies thin, how many spare doses should I send ahead?

speaker: Patient
text: Uh, I think the box is still in my backpack, and I haven’t opened it because the picture looked different—kinda shiny blue stripes instead of the plain gray one I remember. Do I peel off something before it works? Also, the old canister clicked around forty times before it emptied, but I never wrote it down, so I’m not sure when it actually finished; the nurse just shakes it and guesses. If the weather shuts things down, how will we know we’re almost out?
